New Records: Morocco opened their Africa Cup of Nations campaign with a comfortable 3-0 win over Tanzania, with Azzedine Ounahi scoring a stunning goal.
Key Match Events: Romain Saiss scored the opener for Morocco after a fierce Hakim Ziyech free kick was parried by the keeper.
Novatus Miroshi was sent off in the second-half for a reckless sliding challenge.
Azzedine Ounahi scored the second goal for Morocco with a pass into the bottom left corner.
Youssef En-Nesyri scored the third goal for Morocco with a simple one-touch finish after a lengthy VAR check.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco were favourites to win the Africa Cup of Nations, having become the first African side to reach the semi-finals of a World Cup.
Tanzania were struggling and had a tough task ahead of them.
Post-Match Reflections: Morocco's performance was described as one of the best so far in the tournament, with an attacking edge very few can match.
Tanzania will be wondering what they can do to get anything from this group.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game started in a relatively timid fashion, which pleased Tanzanian manager Adel Amrouche.
Morocco's stars began to shine after the first water break, with Hakim Ziyech creating multiple chances for his teammates.
